dict
Inserting a System object (object or instance type) into the algorithm.
The function is used to work with object values.
Syntax
typeObj | instance
Setting
Purpose
typeObj
Selecting the object type.
instance
Selecting the type instance.
The function returns
the
ID
of the specified object.
Note
The function is called using the
button located in the Algorithm Editor on the "Sources" tab.
The modal window opens, where a directory should be specified in the "Object type" field, then select the directory value ("type instance") from the provided list.
Examples
Example № 1
.
It is necessary to send a "Birthday reminder" message template to the emails of users belonging to the "Responsible employee" group. The algorithm will look as follows:
The algorithm uses the
sendMsgToSubject
function,  as the first parameter of the function the prepared template is selected, as the second parameter it is necessary to use the
dict
function, selecting the object type "Access group" and the necessary instance - "Responsible employee".
In place of the remaining parameters
null
can be written.
Example № 2
.
It is necessary to filter the values of the "Employees" attribute: the drop-down list should show only the members of the "Project managers" access group. The algorithm will look as follows:
The
currentUserHasGroup
, function is used for this, whose dummy variable must be replaced with the access group parameter using the
dict
function. The object type is specified as "Access group", and then the necessary instance is selected:
